Course Description: In this course fundamental physical and chemical processes will be used to describe and model a range of fabrication processes making up the various silicon integrated circuit technologies. This course covers everything that professionals need to know, from crystal growth to integrated devices and circuits. Both theory and the practical aspects of each major fabrication step, including crystal growth, silicon oxidation, photolithography, etching, diffusion, ion implantation, and thin film deposition will be covered in this course. It is assumed that students have a quantitative understanding of the basic device physics and structure of diodes, bipolar junction and field-effect transistors

Prerequisites.Mandatory: Solid State Devices & Semiconductor Physics or instructor can give other

Course Outcomes.CO1: Ability to identify IC production cycle, and describe prevaling semiconductor technologies and their role in device processing and trends; to classify various semiconductor material and identify defects in semiconductor materials
Course Outcomes.CO2: Ability to determine and develope process parameter for thermal oxidation process, metallization process, photolithography, Etching and diffusion process
Course Outcomes.CO3: Ability to design the ion implantation process and implement techniques for removing the damage; Ability to generate the flow of IC fabrication process and generate specifications for fabrication of IC resistors, capacitr and inductors; | Abilito to plan processing steps for BJT, MOSFET, BiCMOS, BEOL, SOI, FinFET and MESFET fabrication and choose correct packaging for production
Course Outcomes.CO4: Ability to plan processing steps for BJT, MOSFET, BiCMOS, BEOL, SOI, FinFET and MESFET fabrication and choose correct packaging for production

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction to Semiconductor Fabrication, IC Production Cycle, Semiconductor materials and their properties
Crystal structure, crystal axis and plane, crystal defect and defect electronic properties Crystal Growth – Elementary material, growth from liquid and doping in liquid state
Oxidation - Themal oxidation, Dielectric deposition and polysilicon deposition, Film deposion and metalization
Photolithography – Optical lithography, Pattern generation and mask making printing problems, New techniques in lithography
Etching – Wet chemical etching, dry etching, microelectromechanical systems
Diffusion – Basic diffussion process, extrinsic diffussion, diffussion related process, Silicon and GaAs impurity behaviour
Ion Implantation – Basic of ion implantation, range of implanted ions, implant damage and annealing, implantation related process
Process Integration – IC fabrication process, mask layout, isolation techniques, Passive components
Bipolar technology, MOS Technology and CMOS Technology, BiCMOS, BEOL, SOI, FinFET and MESFET Technology
Assembly, packaging and Testing, Future trends in IC fabrication
